intro: Pfaffia tomentosa, commonly known as curaçao root, is a perennial herb native to the Caribbean islands. It is characterized by its hairy, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a dense white pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and distinctive red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid forests. Due to its unique properties, it has been traditionally used in herbal medicine.
